name: Grishneshwar

deity.mythology_link: Linked with the Ghushma devotion narrative

location.sacred_geography: Near the Ellora cave complex in the Aurangabad region

significance.rank: Twelfth and final Jyotirlinga in the Dwadash Jyotirlinga sequence
significance.philosophy: Grishneshwar is revered as a completion point in the twelve-Jyotirlinga pilgrimage tradition.
significance.scriptural_reference: Shiva Purana and regional Grishneshwar traditions

stats.style: Later-period reconstruction associated with Ahilyabai Holkar patronage
stats.daily_visitors: Varies by season and festival calendar
stats.unique_feature: Proximity to Ellora adds strong heritage and pilgrimage value

description: Grishneshwar, near Ellora, is revered as the twelfth Jyotirlinga. The present temple form is associated with 18th-century restoration patronage by Ahilyabai Holkar, and the shrine remains an important stop for pilgrims completing the Dwadash Jyotirlinga circuit.
secret_hook: Its location near Ellora keeps Grishneshwar at the intersection of living devotion and India's monumental sacred-architecture landscape.
